td.content: s:49 yo white f presents with intrusive thoughts, being easily startled or frightened and self destructive urges. States that she experienced car accident. she states she has never smoked a cigarette in her life she denies drinking alcohol o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. BDI 25, CAPS B=3,C=4,D=3. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed BDI, CAPS, and performed socialization to treatment - Explained that symptoms were common for someone having experienced such trauma; socialization to treatment - Discussed Safety Plan; counseling about life problems - Discussed other life issues - learned that Patient had concern about their partner drug abuse; counseling about life problems - Suggested various social services available for helping to deal with their partner drug abuse; counseling about life problems - Discussed with patient their social support network; Psychiatric diagnostic evaluation - Completed, and ordered homework (fill out standard intake forms), homework (read handouts about PTSD therapy).

td.content: s:49 yr old white f jailer c/o 5 weeks h/o self destructive urges, being easily startled or frightened and intrusive thoughts. Exposed to car accident approx. one (1) year ago. o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. Review of intake forms done, BDI 25, Suicide assessment moderate. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Review of intake forms, BDI, Suicide assessment, and performed socialization to treatment - Discussed homework - helped patient start to fill in goal worksheet; counseling about life problems - Discussed social services to help with their partner drug abuse; social service referral - Patient agreed they wanted to try Nar-Anon; socialization to treatment - Discussed Cognitive-behavioral model of PTSD and that such treatments were mostly contraindicated until patient has stabilized and reduced level of anxiety; socialization to treatment - Discussed value of anxiety management exercises; anxiety management skills - Asked patient to list activities that were found to be relaxing; anxiety management skills - Asked patient to choose a previously close confidant to reengage with; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (finish writing goals for therapy), homework (set up appointment with social service), homework (participate in some of the activities identified as relaxing), homework (attempt to contact previously supportive person and talk with them).

td.content: s:white female aged 49 ys - nh resident c/o 5 weeks h/o trouble sleeping, difficulty concentrating and nightmares.
